title: If there is any adc that should be looked at in the marksman update it should be......

replies.body:
Draven does his job fine, he's oppressive and all but he does what he's supposed to.

Varus on the other hand....

Varus was not made to be an ADC to begin with. He was actually made to be an AD Mid laner, like how people were recently playing him in ProPlay. He was never meant to be the typical Marksmen and Riot has mentioned that, which is why they never made any changes to him when he began to dominate the mid lane and also why they've never given him incentive in the form of buffs to go a more AA based build.

> [{quoted}](name=Zair Umbras,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=o2yB8Xrk,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-10-25T10:36:59.543+0000)
>
> Varus was not made to be an ADC to begin with. He was actually made to be an AD Mid laner, like how people were recently playing him in ProPlay. He was never meant to be the typical Marksmen and Riot has mentioned that, which is why they never made any changes to him when he began to dominate the mid lane and also why they've never given him incentive in the form of buffs to go a more AA based build.

Then they should shift his kit to a full AD caster, no more useless passive, or blight stacks.

Not leave the job half done. They clearly wanted Varus to build attack speed, his W is there for that. They just need to shift him into a proper direction, want him to be an AD caster? murder every part of his marksman kit and replace it with better abilities that complement his AD caster side, instead of leaving him as a shitty ADcarry and an average AD mid who only spams Q.

They have his W and passive the way they do so he's not just blowing his abilities mindlessly. While they could have give him a 3-hit passive, they instead chose to give him good poke and the ability to fend off tanks with a quick 3-AA's then E rather than tossing E and running away. 

Honestly, he's made a comeback every single season except S4, where Assassins were just a bit overly popular. Season 2 when he was released, he was used mid and ADC, especially as an ADC after Corki had gotten nerfed and people wanted poke comparable to Ezreal. S3, he was used as an ADC in pro play as a poke-based champion after Jayce was hit hard with nerfs. Now in S5, he's even been used in World's, though he was used by ROC in one of the worst played games ever (Nine minutes in, letting Riven take an inner for a mid outer).

At least the other ADCs can buy cigars.
